meta.description: d100 roll tables from the campaign. Each table records the full range of outcomes and the actual roll result.

tables.title: Málaga to Rome Sea Voyage
tables.context: Chaos Roll — External forces and random events during the Mediterranean crossing

ranges.label: Catastrophic Storm
ranges.summary: Major Mediterranean storm. Ships scattered, 1-2 vessels separated. Arrive 10-12 days late. 8-15 men lost overboard, 30-40 seriously injured. Morale shaken.

ranges.label: Severe Weather
ranges.summary: Heavy storms force shelter at Sardinia or Corsica for 4-6 days. Arrive 7-9 days late. 2-4 men lost, 10-15 injured. Some horses panic.

ranges.label: Barbary Corsair Encounter
ranges.summary: 3-4 corsair galleys attempt to intercept. Brief skirmish before corsairs flee. 1-3 casualties. Arrive 1-2 days late. Dramatic story for Rome.

ranges.label: Difficult Passage
ranges.summary: Contrary winds and choppy seas. Many crusaders violently seasick. Forced to tack repeatedly. Arrive 3-5 days late. No casualties but morale affected.

ranges.label: Adequate Journey
ranges.summary: Normal spring sailing. Moderate winds, some rough patches. Brief stop at Sardinia or Corsica. Arrive 1-2 days late. Minor incidents only.

ranges.label: Good Sailing
ranges.summary: Favorable winds for most of journey. Arrive exactly on schedule (9-10 days). Dolphins accompany fleet (good omen). No casualties, morale high.

ranges.label: Excellent Voyage
ranges.summary: Perfect spring weather, strong favorable winds. Arrive 1-2 days early. Evening prayers on deck become bonding experience. Ships make port in formation.

ranges.label: Remarkable Journey
ranges.summary: Exceptional conditions. Arrive 2-3 days early. Massive dolphin pod escorts fleet. Word spreads in Rome before arrival. Psychological and spiritual benefit.

ranges.label: Extraordinary — Divine Favor
ranges.summary: Perfect weather, arrive 3 days early. Dolphins escort fleet, white dove lands on ship's mast. Chaplains lead fervent prayers. Anticipation builds in Rome.

ranges.label: Miraculous
ranges.summary: All extraordinary signs plus dreams of Santiago, spontaneous church bells at Ostia. Pope Eugenius hears reports within hours. Arrival becomes legendary.

ranges.label: Acts of God
ranges.summary: Journey becomes subject of future chronicles. Figure in white seen at ship's prow. Pope personally comes to Ostia. Becomes part of the king's legend.

tables.title: Ostia to Rome March
tables.context: Chaos Roll — External forces and random events during the march into Rome

ranges.label: Colonna Ambush Attempt
ranges.summary: 200+ Colonna retainers attempt to block road. Brief violent clash: 12-18 crusaders killed, 30-40 wounded. Colonna routed. Creates immediate crisis.

ranges.label: Hostile Mob Confrontation
ranges.summary: Pro-Colonna mob (300-500) blocks road. Stones, insults. Standoff for 2-3 hours until papal troops disperse mob. 3-6 crusaders injured. Tense atmosphere.

ranges.label: Cold Reception
ranges.summary: March proceeds without violence but Romans notably unwelcoming. Streets empty, shops shuttered. Colonna supporters glare. Psychological warfare.

ranges.label: Mixed Reception — Divided City
ranges.summary: Clear factional divide visible. Some quarters cheer with flowers and kneeling. Others silent with shuttered windows and occasional insults. A few stones thrown.

ranges.label: Cautious but Peaceful
ranges.summary: Romans wary but not hostile. Crowds gather from curiosity more than enthusiasm. No incidents or confrontations. Dignified, respectful, not celebratory.

ranges.label: Curious and Respectful
ranges.summary: Growing crowds, people cross themselves as relics pass. Some elderly Romans weep. Papal supporters take heart. Good first impression on cardinals.

ranges.label: Warm Reception from Papal Faction
ranges.summary: Papal supporters organize welcome. Church bells ring. Flowers, kneeling, chants of Deus Vult. Colonna quarters quiet but no hostility.

ranges.label: Enthusiastic Welcome
ranges.summary: Huge crowds (10,000+). Spontaneous hymns. Even some Colonna supporters caught up. Several cardinals greet at city gates. Pope offers immediate audience.

ranges.label: Triumphant Entry
ranges.summary: Crusader's welcome. 15,000-20,000 line the route. Continuous church bells. Cardinals escort through streets. Pope waiting at St. Peter's steps.

ranges.label: Miraculous Atmosphere
ranges.summary: Bells spontaneously ring across city. White dove circles column. Crowds interpret as divine sign. Even skeptical cardinals moved.

ranges.label: Signs and Wonders
ranges.summary: All miraculous signs plus figure in white walking ahead of column. Blind beggar healed as relics pass. Pope meets outside Vatican weeping.

ranges.label: The Reconquista King Arrives
ranges.summary: Defining moment of the papal-conciliar crisis. Visible divine presence. Pope declares arrival proof of divine favor. Colonna send message of non-opposition.

ranges.label: Acts of God — Historical Moment
ranges.summary: Changes history's trajectory. Shaft of light, spontaneous bells, Santiago sighted on city walls. Cardinals renounce Basel. Colonna seek reconciliation.

tables.title: Pope Eugenius IV's Reaction to Juan's Presentation
tables.context: Persuasion Roll — How the Pope responds to Juan presenting relics, treasury, and documents at St. Peter's

ranges.label: Political Caution Dominates
ranges.summary: Cold, formal reception. No private audience offered. Pope treats as protocol fulfillment. Colonna faction relaxed. Will take significant effort for real support.

ranges.label: Grateful but Guarded
ranges.summary: Warmer but restrained. Offers private audience. Doesn't commit publicly. Personal gratitude visible but political calculations dominant.

ranges.label: Moved but Cautious
ranges.summary: Genuine emotional response. Public release from oath with warmth. Private audience clearly offered. Still no strong public commitments.

ranges.label: Deeply Grateful, Politically Aware
ranges.summary: Pope embraces Juan. Uses success to make point about papal authority. Private discussions opening. Hints at wanting continued alliance. Petitions seriously considered.

ranges.label: Providential Timing
ranges.summary: Pope recognizes strategic opportunity. Uses presentation to argue against Basel's claims. Strong alliance forming visibly. Petitions likely favorable.

ranges.label: Divine Vindication
ranges.summary: Pope sees arrival as divine judgment on conciliar conflict. Strong public endorsement. Major political event. Juan central to Roman politics.

ranges.label: Transformation
ranges.summary: Pope falls to knees. Profound personal and political shift. All petitions granted on the spot. Pope emboldened against Basel and Colonna.

ranges.label: Legendary Moment
ranges.summary: Shaft of sunlight illuminates scene. Pope raises True Cross. Chronicles will record for centuries. Basel faction severely damaged. All petitions granted.

ranges.label: Acts of God — Historical Watershed
ranges.summary: Spontaneous bells, shaft of light, thousands kneeling. Cardinals renounce Basel, Colonna seek reconciliation. Emperor Sigismund hastens to Rome.

tables.title: Pope Eugenius IV's Response to Juan's Confession of Faith
tables.context: Persuasion Roll — How the Pope responds to Juan's emotional confession about faith and the Church's purity

ranges.label: Moved but Guarded
ranges.summary: Pope appreciates sentiment but remains cautious. Acknowledges corruption exists. Warm but keeps emotional distance. Practical matters discussed without deep bond.

ranges.label: Grateful but Burdened
ranges.summary: Pope embraces Juan longer than protocol. Tears in his eyes. Opens up about struggles but can't fully embrace Juan's idealism. Respect but not yet deep alliance.

ranges.label: Deeply Moved — Spiritual Recognition
ranges.summary: Pope kneels beside Juan. Grips his hands. Sees Juan's pure faith as rare and precious. Deep personal bond forming. Petitions granted. Strong alliance.

ranges.label: Breakthrough Moment — Mutual Recognition
ranges.summary: Pope removes tiara, dismisses cardinals. Confesses his private doubts about papal authority. Sees Juan as answer to prayers for a sign. Deep spiritual bond. All petitions granted. Pope speaks with new authority.

ranges.label: Transformative Spiritual Experience
ranges.summary: Pope collapses sobbing. Complete vulnerability. Shares deepest fears. Juan's faith restores Pope's certainty. Strongest possible alliance. Pope proclaims Juan defender of the faith.

ranges.label: Divine Moment — Legendary Bond
ranges.summary: Room seems to glow. Pope transformed. Cardinals called to witness. Major proclamation. Basel-supporting cardinals shift. Colonna patriarch seeks reconciliation.

ranges.label: Acts of God — Historical Transformation
ranges.summary: Spontaneous bells ring across Rome again. Thousands kneel in the plaza. Cardinals fall to their knees. Five Basel cardinals renounce conciliar supremacy. Church politics fundamentally altered.
